pros: You get paid and some experience.

Patients who are cranky because they are sick and in pain, and you better believe they’re gonna complain about you, and you better get used to management siding with them. Nurses who will send you a patient without screening them like they’re asked to, and when it causes even the slightest situation, it’s all on you. A CEO who manages to pay himself a several hundred thousand dollar, sometimes million dollar, bonus some years, but nothing left over for the team members who keep the doors open. No consistencies in shifts. Typical tax shelter corporate hospital the hides behind the guise of ‘charity’ and ‘positivity’. Sure, get paid, get some experience, but most importantly keep your eyes on the prize to capture the next opportunity upward, because if you have any ambition or self respect, you’ll come to quickly realize, that upward momentum ain’t here.
